page.title: 20 THE DEVIL'S STONE
page.content: In the middle of a field belonging to Pantycaragle, a farm near Beguildy School, is a big stone and a local legend explains how it got there. At Craig Don Wood,between Knucklas and Knighton is a large rock known as The Devil's Chair. One day the Devil was sitting in his chair planning evil deeds. He decided to destroy Beguildy Church. He picked up a large boulder and threw it,shouting "Hey up!" This was for people to get out of the way. Acoording to the legend this is how the village of Heyope got its name.The boulder fell short and landed in the field where it lies to this day. The church at Beguildy is dedicated to St. Michael who saved it from destruction. Every time the land-owner has tried to move the stone there has been a great storm. God wants the stone left there as a reminder that Good defeats Evil.
